intro: Polygonum mite var. condensatum, commonly known as the compact knotweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Polygonaceae family. It is characterized by its stout, reddish stems and heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive waxy coating. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found along streambanks and in wetlands. Due to its rapid growth and invasive tendencies, it is considered a problematic species in many regions.
